summary: Protobuf messages returned from CRON scheduled workflows cannot be decoded when fetching previous results via Workflow::getLastCompletionResult(). The issue was resolved by explicitly declaring the return type using the #[ReturnType] attribute.
userImpact: Users cannot retrieve protobuf-encoded results from CRON scheduled workflows without explicitly specifying the return type.
rootCause: The DataConverter cannot properly decode protobuf values without explicit type information provided via the #[ReturnType] attribute.
proposedFix: Add explicit #[ReturnType(ClassName::class)] attribute to the WorkflowInterface method definition.
workaround: Use the #[ReturnType] attribute on workflow methods that return protobuf messages and access the result object via type-safe getters.
resolutionDetails: User confirmed that adding explicit #[ReturnType] attribute to the workflow method resolved the decoding issue.
keyQuote: Try to do the following: In your WorkflowInterface add explicit attribute for the return type
